All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Actions
Indicates possible actions that the player can perform through the GUI.
Board
The primary data class for the game.
Color
Properties that belong to a color group.
Color.ColorGroupKeys
Which color group the Color object belongs to.
The default value is unspecified.
DialogContainer
A template for dialog creation.
DialogContainerAbout
Dialog, About: Provides information about the project.
DialogContainerAuction
 
DialogContainerDebugLog
A simple dialog that contains a JTextArea for viewing the debug log contents.
DialogContainerForfeit
Dialog, Forfeit: An optional dialog that allows the player to forfeit the game under appropriate conditions.
Provides options for forfeit confirmation and cancelling the action (close the dialog).
DialogContainerGameEditor
Dialog, Game Editor: Provides many actions that the user can perform to modify game state.
Useful for debugging.
DialogContainerImprovements
Dialog, Improvements: An optional dialog that allows the player to construct improvements on their Color properties.
Provides options for building and selling houses and hotels.
DialogContainerJail
Dialog, Jail: A mandatory dialog shown when the game rolls over to a jailed player's turn.
Provides options for posting bail, rolling for doubles, and using a Get Out of Jail Free Card.
DialogContainerMortgage
Dialog, Mortgage: An optional dialog that allows the user to mortgage or lift the mortgage of a property they own.
Provides options for mortgaging and lifting the mortgage of a property.
DialogContainerPurchaseProperty
Dialog, Purchase Property: A mandatory dialog that prompts the user to either purchase or auction a property they land on.
Provides options for purchasing and auctioning a property.
DialogContainerStartGame
Dialog, Start Game: An optional dialog that allows the user to configure basic game settings, and start the game when ready.
Provides options for player count and custom player names; allows starting the game.
DrawCard
 
DrawCard.DestinationRelativeTypeKeys
For DrawCard objects of type teleportRelative, this describes the target teleport destination, relative to the player, to be calculated given the player's position.
The default value is unspecified.
DrawCard.DrawCardTypeKeys
The type of DrawCard event that describes this object.
The default value is unspecified.
DynamicView
 
GameEditorActions
Possible actions the user may perform from within the Game Editor.
GameEditorController
 
GameEvent
 
GameEvent.gameEventTypeKeys
The type of GameEvent that describes this object.
The default value is unspecified.
GameLogicController
Controls game logic and updates data within the Board accordingly.
GameLogicController.ImprovementsActions
Possible actions that a player can execute when modifying improvements on a Color space.
GameLogicController.MortgageActions
 
GameLogicSwitchboard
An intermediary layer between the DynamicView and GameLogicController objects.
GUI objects whose listener objects extend from ActionEvent, and have an accessible Actions property, can have their triggers modified in this class.
JavaMonopoly
The main class for the application.
LogHelper
An object that has one instantiation across all classes in the application, and assists with logging for both the game view and debug log views.
MacroController
 
MenuActions
Possible actions the user may perform through the menu bar.
Player
 
Property
 
Property.propertyTypeKeys
 
Property.QueryRentStates
 
Railroad
 
SerialState
 
Space
 
Space.spaceTypeKeys
 
Statistics
 
SwingHelper
 
SwingHelper.LabelStyles
 
TemplateDialogButtonProperties
 
TemplateDialogGenerator
 
Utility
 
ViewAreaSpaceSelection
 
ViewComponent
 
ViewFrameBoard
 
ViewFrameBoard.SpaceButton
 
ViewFrameControl
 
ViewFrameInformation
 
ViewFrameInformationModule
